agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
site_name: FIREFLY CHILDREN AND FAMILY ALLIANCE - CONNERSVILLE
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY (CPCS) - REGION 12
service_description: Provides a home-based child abuse and neglect prevention program to Fayette, Franklin, Henry, Rush, Union, and Wayne County families with children. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs and may include case management, advocacy, parent education, and referrals to community resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS), or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open juvenile probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: Provides animal control for the city of Connersville and an animal shelter for Fayette County.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Fayette County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, accepts surrendered animals from the public, and provides shelter and adoption services for homeless and unwanted dogs and cats. Due to space limitations, not all surrendered animals can be held for adoption and may be euthanized at any time.
site_details: Adopt or Claim: Call or walk in. -- Clients should be prepared to provide contact information for their landlord (if applicable) -- To Surrender: Call to schedule an appointment to surrender animal. For after-hour emergencies, call Fayette County Dispatch.
site_eligibility: To Report an Animal Concern: Open (serves the town of Connersville in Fayette County) -- To Adopt: Open (subject to review by staff to ensure safety of animal)To Surrender a Pet: Living in Fayette County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Fayette County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8:30am-noon and 1pm-5pm

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - FAYETTE COUNTY - CIRCUIT, SMALL CLAIMS, AND SUPERIOR COURTS
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Fayette County, the people are given a choice  of Superior or Circuit Court to handle small claims cases.
site_details: Call or walk in to the County Clerk's office.
site_schedule: Circuit Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm; Wed 8:30am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon -- Superior Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Fayette County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Fayette County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Fayette County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - FAYETTE COUNTY - CIRCUIT, SMALL CLAIMS, AND SUPERIOR COURTS
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the swithboard.
site_schedule: Circuit Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm; Wed 8:30am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon -- Superior Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm; Thurs 8am-12:30pm
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon, Tues, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm; Thurs 8am-12:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: A state-funded program offering instruction and testing for the High School Equivalency diploma, as well as English as a second language (ESL) classes.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place on a monthly-basis and is available in computer format.
site_details: Call or text to cell phone to register for the test. Payment due at registration.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: A state-funded program offering instruction and testing for the High School Equivalency diploma, as well as English as a second language (ESL) classes.

site_eligibility: Age 16 and older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon noon-3pm; Tues noon-4pm; Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 1pm-7pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women -- New parents

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers family planning, pregnancy testing, and various parenting education programs.
service_description: Offers an eight-week, individual counseling program from a faith-based, pro-life perspective for women that have previously terminated their pregnancy, had a still birth or miscarriage.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon noon-3pm; Tues noon-4pm; Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 1pm-7pm
site_eligibility: Open to women who have had an abortion, miscarriage, or a still birth

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers family planning, pregnancy testing, and various parenting education programs.
service_description: Provides free, confidential pregnancy testing and offers consultation to persons experiencing an unplanned pregnancy. site_details: Call or visit the website to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon noon-3pm; Tues noon-4pm; Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 1pm-7pm
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 13 or older

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - FAYETTE COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Fayette County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). Persons already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Applications for the waiting list is closed. When they are open, you will be required to create a Waitlist Check account and have a valid email address.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-5pm; Fri 8am-4pm -- Waiting List: CLOSED
site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families

agency_desc: A collection of services offered by Fayette County government offices.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in the County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Fayette County

agency_desc: "OVGC is an investor-owned utility which provides natural gas distribution and transportation services to residential, commercial, industrial, and governmental customers in 16 Indiana counties and 1 county in Ohio."
site_name: OHIO VALLEY GAS CORPORATION - CONNERSVILLE DISTRICT
service_description: Provides natural gas utility services and handles billing and connections/disconnections for customers in select areas of Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Ripley, and Union County. Special payment plans, including a budget payment plan to spread the cost of service out more equally throughout the year, may be available for customers.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Service area includes portions of Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Ripley, and Union County

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
site_schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
